Mission.Author: KingRaptor
Mission.Description: Abbreviated tutorial for the campaign. Not to be played independently.
Mission.Name: Quick Tutorial

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Action (Alternate)
TriggerLogic.CodeStr:
local units = GG.mission.FindUnitsInGroup("Gaia") for unitID in pairs(units) do Spring.TransferUnit(unitID, Spring.GetGaiaTeamID(), false) end
Spring.SetGameRulesParam("tutorial_has_next_button", 1)
GG.CommandLocker.LockCMD(CMD.MOVE) GG.CommandLocker.LockCMD(31109) -- raw move

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Comm Spawn
TriggerLogic.CodeStr:
if not Spring.GetModOptions().commandertypes then GG.mission.ExecuteTriggerByName("Spawn Comm Fallback") else local teamID = 0 local teamInfo = teamID and select(7, Spring.GetTeamInfo(teamID)) if teamInfo and teamInfo.staticcomm then local commanderName = teamInfo.staticcomm local commanderLevel = teamInfo.staticcomm_level or 1 local commanderProfile = GG.ModularCommAPI.GetCommProfileInfo(commanderName) local startUnit = commanderProfile.baseUnitDefID
local x, z = 2750, 3580 local y = Spring.GetGroundHeight(x, z) local unitID = GG.DropUnit(startUnit, x, y, z, 0, teamID, _, _, _, _, _, GG.ModularCommAPI.GetProfileIDByBaseDefID(startUnit), teamInfo and tonumber(teamInfo.static_level), true) Spring.SetUnitNeutral(unitID, true) GG.mission.AddUnitGroup(unitID,"Comm") Spring.Echo("yahahahaha", unitID) end end

TriggerLogic.Name: Add Objective
TriggerLogic.Description: Learn the bare basics of playing Zero-K. Follow the provided instructions at each step.
TriggerLogic.Title: Complete Quick Tutorial

TriggerLogic.CodeStr:
-- hide economy panel if WG.EconomyPanel then WG.EconomyPanel.SetEconomyPanelVisibility(false) end
--Spring.SelectUnitArray({}, false)

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
First, let's go over the ways to move the camera:
+ The \255\0\255\0\arrow keys\008. + Moving the \255\0\255\0\cursor\008 to the \255\0\255\0\screen edge\008 (requires fullscreen mode). + \255\0\255\0\Middle click\008 and \255\0\255\0\drag\008 the terrain. + \255\0\255\0\Middle click\008 or \255\0\255\0\left click\008 click on the minimap. + \255\0\255\0\Scroll wheel\008 or \255\0\255\0\Page Up/Down\008 to zoom in/out.
Zoom in close on your commander on the \255\255\255\0\left\008 side of the map.

You've found your commander. Select it by \255\0\255\0\left clicking\008 on it.
(If you've already selected it, left click on the ground to deselect first).
With your commander selected, \255\255\255\0\move\008 to the designated location to the right. \255\0\255\0\Right click\008 on the ground to move there.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Marker
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: if WG.CustomMarker then WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("destination1", 3410, 3580, "Go here") end

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: Select all your units by \255\255\255\0\clicking\008 and \255\255\255\0\dragging a box\008 around them.

Draw a \255\255\255\0\line formation\008 with the mouse. + Select \255\255\255\0\all\008 your units. + \255\0\255\0\Right click\008 and drag to draw a line. + Release right click.
Move your units into the indicated circles with a line formation.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Marker
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: if WG.CustomMarker then WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("lineMove1", 4185, 3445, "Click and drag from here...") WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("lineMove2", 4080, 3745, "...to here and let go") end

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: An enemy building has appeared. Select your units and \255\0\255\0\right click\008 on the target to \255\255\255\0\attack\008 it.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Marker
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: if WG.CustomMarker then WG.CustomMarker.ClearPoints() WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("target1", 4855, 3580, "Target", {1, 0.5, 0.5}) end

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Action (Alternate)
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: Spring.SetGameRulesParam("tutorial_stage", 7) GG.CommandLocker.LockCMD(CMD.MOVE) GG.CommandLocker.LockCMD(31109) -- raw move GG.CommandLocker.LockCMD(CMD.ATTACK) GG.CommandLocker.UnlockCMD(30100) -- area mex

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Build a \255\0\255\255\Metal Extractor\008 on the \255\255\255\0\mex spot\008. This will supply \255\255\255\0\metal\008 needed for construction.
+ Select your commander + Left click the \255\255\255\0\Orders\008 tab in the menu + Press \255\0\255\0\W\008 + \255\0\255\0\Left click and drag\008 a circle on the ground covering the mex spot

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Action (Alternate)
TriggerLogic.CodeStr:
if WG.ChiliHighlight then WG.ChiliHighlight.ClearControls()
-- highlight area mex WG.ChiliHighlight.AddControlFunc("orderTab", function() if WG.IntegralMenu.GetCommandButtonPosition(30100) then return {} end return {WG.IntegralMenu.GetTabPosition("orders")} end, nil, true)
WG.ChiliHighlight.AddControlFunc("areaMexButton", function() return {WG.IntegralMenu.GetCommandButtonPosition(30100)} end, nil, true) end
if WG.EconomyPanel then WG.EconomyPanel.SetEconomyPanelVisibility(true) end

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
We also need a \255\0\255\255\Solar Collector\008 to produce energy.
+ Click the \255\255\255\0\Econ\008 tab in the menu (highlighted) + Left click the Solar Collector button + Left click on the ground where you want to place the building

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Let's make a \255\255\255\0\factory\008 to build units. Build a \255\0\255\255\Cloaky Bot Factory\008.
+ Select your commander + Click the Factory tab in the menu (highlighted) + Left click the Cloaky Bot Factory button + Left click on the ground where you want to place the building

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Let's make some units with our factory. Build five \255\0\255\255\Glaive\008 bots.
+ Select your new factory + Left click the \255\255\255\0\Units\008 tab + Left click Glaive five times

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Action (Alternate)

TriggerLogic.CodeStr:
Spring.SetGameRulesParam("tutorial_stage", 11)
--GG.CommandLocker.UnlockCMD(CMD.MOVE) GG.CommandLocker.UnlockCMD(31109) -- raw move GG.CommandLocker.UnlockCMD(CMD.ATTACK) GG.CommandLocker.UnlockCMD(CMD.FIGHT) GG.CommandLocker.UnlockCMD(CMD.STOP) GG.CommandLocker.UnlockCMD(30100) -- area mex

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Use your Glaives to destroy \255\255\255\0\all enemies\008 to the right. Try using an \255\255\255\0\Attack Move\008 order.
+ Select your units and press \255\0\255\0\A\008 + Left click on attack move destination

Well done. Now you know the basics of Zero-K.
Click Next to end the tutorial.

TriggerLogic.CodeStr: Spring.SetGameRulesParam("tutorial_show_next_button", 0) if GG.MissionGameOver then GG.MissionGameOver(true) else GG.mission.ExecuteTriggerByName("Victory Fallback") end

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message
TriggerLogic.Message:
Hello? Is this thing on?
Alright, I see you're here. This tutorial will teach you the basics of the user interface in Zero-K. Pay attention – we'll try not to let you do anything you shouldn't, but things will go faster if you follow instructions precisely.
NOTE: This tutorial assumes default keybinds. If you have changed key bindings for some commands, they may not match what is listed in the tutorial.
